document.description: Examples of the lemma smart from the MASC project for FN annotation
document.name: smart

sentence.text: Pollitt 's men were dressed identically , in smart green boiler suits , and they 'd obviously been sent here to make Spring Mill secure yet again .
How about a smart shirt , and a new tie ?
Even wee Jamie looked smart in a new shirt and trousers and a bow tie .
The 35-year-old is chief valuation assistant for Liverpool City Council , which means she always has to look smart for work .
He took her to a rather smart Italian restaurant full of intimate little tables far too close together for private conversation .
The drake is smart rather than spectacular in appearance .
Many are being refitted with the same smart new decor which will make them easier to spot on the high street .
Her father gave her a smart blue dress , her mother an equally smart green dress .
He was about to touch the door when a man in a smart blue uniform opened it .
The same reasoning , I suspect , saw to it that at one time you could n't get olives , only peanut and crisps , in smart bars in Spain , because olives were what peasants ate .
The bonus to the restaurant was that its name would be emblazoned on the side of the bins in smart gold letters .
Her wardrobe is full of tops -- from the smart blouses she needs to wear on TV to a colourful collection of jumpers that she can wear around the home .
They go , in their smart suits and ties , back to the village .
During the war years Harold had risen to the rank of major in the Canadian Army and he looked very smart in his uniform .
Lawrence , smart in a grey pinstripe suit , was preparing breakfast in the kitchen while glancing at the sports pages of the Daily Telegraph .
Whitsuntide was the traditional time for wearing new clothes and the little girls were all smart in their prettiest dresses , mostly white , with ribbons and flowers in their hair .
She was wearing a smart , oatmeal-coloured trouser-suit , the trousers pushed into high leather boots .
Included in your holiday price is a smart Sovereign Worldwide travel bag which , when not in use , can be folded away into a neat 8½″ by 8½″ square by zipping the ends together .
Vegetarianism has stepped out of its sandals and into the smartest restaurants .
Now they had a smart restaurant in Blackheath , another in Knightsbridge , and a chain of pizza houses .
Since they 're only at the start of their two-month US tour , BMG sent them down to Next for some smart fashions .
You do n't have any smart pyjamas or anything to be going to stay with people .
The next evening when he got home , Amanda was in the sitting-room watching television , wearing her smartest clothes .

Providing a cultural counterpoint a block north of the Convention Center , Vancouver architect Arthur Erickson 's transparent Roy Thomson Hall glows at night to show off the throngs of smart concert - goers attending the Toronto Symphony Orchestra .

The largest , by far , is the modern section and the center of this , clustered around the palm trees and fountains of the Parque de la Alameda , is taken up with busy sidewalk cafés , smart boutiques , banks , and real estate agents ' offices .
For more accessible entertainment , Nueva Gerona , the island 's little capital , is moderately attractive , with striped awnings along its smart , pillared main street .
Its long lines and minimalist façade once housed administrative offices , but the interior has been transformed into a smart shopping mall with luxury goods from jewelry to cigars .
In recent years , great numbers of smart new shopping malls and department stores have sprung up in Berlin , the most exciting of which are in the east of the city .

A motley crowd is hurrying by -- workers in dungarees ; a yogi with his followers ; a noblewoman in purdah in palanquin ; a group of nautch girls , attractive in their aniline - dyed dresses and bright bandanas , their bangles jingling and their long , shampooed hair streaming in the breeze ; a sepoy all smart in khaki on his horse , his jodhpurs trim and neat ; a scholarly pundit ; a mahout on his elephant , ambling like a juggernaut .
The smart uniforms and pomp are taken directly from British ceremonial activities , but the ambiance is truly Bahamian .
